subject: Re: [junit] @DataPoint on fields does not seem to be significant
msgSnippet: David, Just to make sure: do you mean that the AllMembersSupplier s addFields method should filter fields those having a @DataPoint annotation and not just all
messageBody:
David,

Just to make sure: do you mean that the AllMembersSupplier's addFields
method should filter fields those having a @DataPoint annotation and not
just all that are public and static?

Raphael


On Thu, Oct 23, 2008 at 7:46 PM, David Saff <david@...> wrote:

> Raphael,
>
> You're right. It's a bug. Only @DataPoint fields should be used.
> Can you log the bug? Thanks,
>
> David Saff
>
>
> On Thu, Oct 23, 2008 at 3:47 AM, Raphael Parree <rparree@...<rparree%40gmail.com>>
> wrote:
> > Hi,
> >
> > Looking at the default data supplier for Theories (
> > org.junit.experimental.theories.internal.AllMembersSupplier) it seems to
> me
> > the @DataPoint annotation only has an effect on methods. If that is
> indeed
> > the case perhaps the annotation should be defined with Target
> > ElementType.METHOD?
> >
> > The reason is that the AllMembersSupplier's getValueSources uses the
> > addFields which includes all public static fields regardless of any
> > annotation (except for the plurar version DataPoints for arrays).
> Therefore
> > it does not matter whether you use the @DataPoint annotation on fields.
> > Perhaps the implementation of addFields should use it, in which case the
> > target of the @DataPoint annotation should include fields.
> >
> > Thanks,
> >
> > Raphael
> >
> > [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
> >
> >
>
